summary.p: A copy of the Kūḷappanāyakkaṉ Viṟaliviṭutūtu.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (January 2024).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

support.p: U2: nice and regular leaves, rounded edges.

collation.desc: 1 folio = front guard leaf. Half of a bifolio. Blank recto verso. 375 x 31 mm.
1 folio = Kūḷappanāyakkaṉ Viṟaliviṭutūtu: Invocation & Colophon. No foliation. Verso blank. 378 x 32 mm.

71 folios = Kūḷappanāyakkaṉ Viṟaliviṭutūtu: Text. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-47.1, 47.2, 48-70. 378 x 32 mm. f47.2 is a smaller (377 x 28 mm) and has only 4 lpp; it seems to be in fact foliated "47-48", that is, it is an addition by hand #1 to be inserted between f47 and f48. f55-f70 are smaller (375 x 31 mm).
1 folio = back guard leaf. Half of a bifolio. Blank recto verso. 375 x 33 mm.

layoutDesc.layout: Tidy layout in U2b (except for f[1]r): 1 stanza per line, with taṉiccol separated by blank space, so that it appears, at first sight, as a proper 2-column layout. No verse numbering.

handNote.desc: Hand #1. It seems that this hand #1 is responsible for the writing in the left margin and most of the first line of the main written area in U2a, f[1]r, and again in U2b, from f44r6 up to the end.
Hand #2. It seems that this hand #2 is responsible only for the writing of most of U2a, f[1]r, and for in U2b, from the beginning upto f44r6.

additions.desc:
Notes in black on an inserted sheet of paper (103 x 66 mm, folded):

que ne l'est ordinairement celle des livres
tamouls est écrit avec le plus grand soin; les
caractères ont été noircis. le ms. 52 fets
Same text as in Catalogue Burnouf, p. 346, no. 167.
BnF shelfmark sticker, covering an older sticker: INDIEN 383 (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark "N° 11" in black ink and "902" in chalk (f[1]r).
Arabic foliation "69" added in black ink (f69r), typical of Burnouf manuscripts.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. Same design, but not of the usual light colour.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1790 by VinsonVinson and to 1790 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

provenance.p: Copy made for Ucaṉ Cāyapu (Hussein? Sahib) by his friend Mayil Piḷḷai. See U2a, f[1]r2-4. — Owned by Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852). See S.n. 1854, p. 346, no. 167:

acquisition.p: Acquired, August 2nd, 1854, from “Madame veuve Burnouf”. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 2 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1893, no. 4955.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
